critique: This document focuses on improving mathematics education through the establishment of a national advisory panel. It aims to support American talent and innovation by fostering greater knowledge and performance in mathematics among students. The order emphasizes evidence-based instruction and research, involving various stakeholders such as federal agencies, state and local officials, experts, parents, and teachers. There is no direct mention of immigration, executive power, federalism, security/liberty, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, the assessment focuses on the implied aspects of education and governance.
